contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom God has called to be holy people" Possible meanings are 1) "whom God has set apart for himself" or 2) "whom God has called to separate themselves from sin" or "whom God has called to not sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who are called to be holy people

contextId.information: Paul speaks of "words of human wisdom" as if they were people, the cross as a container, and of power as a physical thing that Jesus can put in that container. This can be stated in active form. AT: "words of human wisdom ... those words of human wisdom should not empty the cross of Christ of its power" or "words of human wisdom ... people should not stop believing the message about Jesus and start thinking I am more important than Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: words of human wisdom ... the cross of Christ should not be emptied of its power

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that which people usually regard as without value" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: things that are regarded as nothing

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "things that people think are worth money" or "things that people think are worth respect" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: things that are held as valuable

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will show everyone what the builder has done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his work will be revealed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "if the fire destroys anyone's work" or "if the fire ruins anyone's work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: if anyone's work is burned up

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he will lose that work and any reward he might have earned if that work had survived the fire, but God will save him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will suffer loss, but he himself will be saved

contextId.information: "When people revile us, we bless them" or "When people scorn us, we bless them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When we are reviled, we bless

contextId.information: "When people slander us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When we are slandered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that not even the Gentiles permit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that is not even permitted among the Gentiles

contextId.information: "a believer submits that case" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that case is placed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has cleansed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you have been cleansed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has made you right with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you have been made right with God

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will not allow these things to rule over me like a master" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I will not be mastered by any of them

contextId.information: This can also be stated in active form. AT: "when the Lord joins his spirit to the spirit of a person, it is as if their spirits become one spirit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he who is joined to the Lord becomes one spirit with him

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "For God has set apart the unbelieving husband for himself because of his believing wife" or 2) "God treats the unbelieving husband as he would treat a son for the sake of his believing wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For the unbelieving husband is set apart because of his wife

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "God has set apart the unbelieving wife for himself because of her husband who believes" or 2) "God treats the unbelieving wife as he would treat a daughter for the sake of her husband who believes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the unbelieving wife is set apart because of the brother

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "God has set them apart for himself" or 2) "God treats them as he would treat his own children" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they are set apart

contextId.information: "In such cases, God does not require the believing spouse to continue to obey the marriage vow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: In such cases, the brother or sister is not bound to their vows

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God knows that person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] )
contextId.quote: that person is known by him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so you will do something for me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so something might be done for me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I must do this work that God trusted me to complete" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I still have a responsibility that was entrusted to me

contextId.information: This passive sentence can be rephrased to an active form. AT: "the judge will say that I obeyed the rules." In this case the "judge," the one who will not disqualify Paul, is a metaphor for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: I myself may not be disqualified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "did. As a result, snakes destroyed them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: did and were destroyed by snakes

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "did. As a result, an angel of death destroyed them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: did and were destroyed by an angel of death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God had Moses write them down so we would learn to do what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They were written for our instruction

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "will not allow anyone to tempt you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: will not let you be tempted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: Possible meanings are 1) "must not cover his head" or 2) "does not need to cover his head" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: should not have his head covered

contextId.information: God made the woman by taking a bone from the man and making the woman from that bone. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God did not make the man from the woman. Instead, he made the woman from the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For man was not made from woman. Instead, woman was made from man

contextId.information: Paul expects the Corinthians to agree with him. This can be stated in active form. "To honor God, a woman should pray to God with a covering on her head." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "on the night that Judas Iscariot betrayed him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: on the night when he was betrayed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Lord judges us, he disciplines us, so that he will not condemn us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: we are judged by the Lord, we are disciplined, so that we may not be condemned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you believed lies and worshiped voiceless idols" See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you were led astray to voiceless idols

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. God is the one who does the giving ([[:en:bible:notes:1co:12:04|12:6]]). AT: "God gives to each one" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to each one is given

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God gives." See how this is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:1co:12:07|12:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: is given

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) the Holy Spirit is the one who baptizes us, "For one Spirit baptized us" or 2) that the Spirit, like the water of baptism, is the medium through which we are baptized into the body, "For in one Spirit we were all baptized" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: For by one Spirit we were all baptized

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone gives honor to one member" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: one member is honored

contextId.information: This can be made active. AT: "I allow those who persecute me to burn me to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I give my body to be burned

contextId.information: This can be stated as active. AT: "just as Christ has known me fully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: just as I have been fully known

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to what they say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to what is said

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you may encourage all" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all may be encouraged

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you should not recognize him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: let him not be recognized

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they buried him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was buried

contextId.information: This can stated as active. AT: "the Son himself will become subject" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the Son himself will be subjected

contextId.information: God made the first man, Adam, from the dust of the earth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The first man is of the earth, made of dust

contextId.information: "God will change us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: We will be changed
